info.title: CyberVPN Backend API
info.description: Backend API for CyberVPN admin dashboard

post.description:
Authenticate user and return access and refresh tokens.

Security:
- Brute force protection with progressive lockout
- Constant-time response to prevent user enumeration

Refresh access token using refresh token.

MED-002: Validates device fingerprint when ENFORCE_TOKEN_BINDING is enabled.
Logout user by invalidating refresh token and clearing auth cookies.

Logout from all devices by revoking all user tokens (HIGH-6).

Revokes all access and refresh tokens for the current user.

get.description: Get current authenticated user information.

delete.description:
Soft-delete the current user's account (FEAT-03).

Sets is_active=False and deleted_at, then revokes all refresh tokens
and JWT access tokens. The user will be immediately logged out of all
devices.

post.description:
Verify OTP code for email verification.

On success:
1. Activates user account
2. Creates user in Remnawave VPN backend
3. Returns access/refresh tokens (auto-login)

Resend OTP verification code.

Uses Brevo (secondary provider) for resend requests.
Rate limited to 3 resends per hour per email.

Request a magic link for passwordless login.

Always returns success to prevent email enumeration.

Verify magic link token and return JWT tokens.

If user doesn't exist, creates a new account with verified email.

Authenticate via Telegram Mini App initData.

Validates HMAC-SHA256 signature, checks auth_date freshness,
auto-registers or auto-logs-in the Telegram user.

Authenticate via one-time Telegram bot login link token.

The bot generates a /login link containing a one-time token.
This endpoint consumes the token and issues JWT tokens.

Generate a one-time Telegram bot login link (admin/bot-only).

Creates a token in Redis with 5-minute TTL, returns a deep link URL.

Request password reset OTP code.

Always returns success to prevent email enumeration.
Reset password using OTP code from forgot-password email.

Register a new user with email verification.

Creates user with is_active=False, is_email_verified=False.
Sends OTP verification email to the provided address.
User must verify email before logging in.

Security:
- Registration is disabled by default (REGISTRATION_ENABLED=false)
- When enabled with invite-only mode, requires valid invite token
- All registration attempts are logged for audit

parameters.name: invite_token

schema.description: Invite token required for registration when invite-only mode is enabled
schema.title: Invite Token

parameters.description: Invite token required for registration when invite-only mode is enabled

post.description:
Register a new mobile app user.

Creates a new user account with the provided email and password,
registers the device, and returns authentication tokens.

**Error Codes:**
- `EMAIL_EXISTS`: Email already registered (409)

429.description: Too many registration attempts (limit: 3/min per IP)

post.description:
Authenticate a mobile app user.

Validates credentials, updates device registration, and returns tokens.

**Error Codes:**
- `INVALID_CREDENTIALS`: Wrong email/password or account disabled (401)

429.description: Too many login attempts (limit: 5/min per device)

post.description:
Refresh authentication tokens.

Exchanges a valid refresh token for new access and refresh tokens.

**Error Codes:**
- `INVALID_TOKEN`: Refresh token is invalid, expired, or device mismatch (401)

Logout a mobile app user.

Revokes the refresh token and optionally removes device registration.

**Error Codes:**
- `INVALID_TOKEN`: Token is invalid or device mismatch (401)

get.description:
Get current user profile.

Returns the authenticated user's profile with subscription information.

**Error Codes:**
- `UNAUTHORIZED`: Not authenticated (401)
- `USER_NOT_FOUND`: User account not found (404)

post.description:
Register or update a mobile device.

Registers a new device or updates existing device information.
Used for push notifications and session management.

**Error Codes:**
- `UNAUTHORIZED`: Not authenticated (401)

Authenticate via Telegram Login Widget.

Validates Telegram OAuth callback data and creates or links user account.
New users are auto-created from Telegram profile data.

**Error Codes:**
- `INVALID_TELEGRAM_AUTH`: Invalid signature or malformed data (400)
- `TELEGRAM_AUTH_EXPIRED`: auth_date is older than 24 hours (401)

201.description: New user created and authenticated via Telegram

401.description: Telegram authentication expired or invalid signature

get.description:
Get Telegram OAuth authorization URL with CSRF state token.

The state token must be included in the callback request.

Get GitHub OAuth authorization URL with CSRF state token.

The state token must be included in the callback request.

post.description:
Process Telegram OAuth callback and link account.

Validates:
1. CSRF state token
2. HMAC-SHA256 signature using bot token
3. auth_date is within acceptable range (24 hours)

get.description:
Telegram OAuth callback (GET alias for mobile compatibility).

**DEPRECATED**: Use POST /oauth/telegram/callback instead.

This is an alias route for backward compatibility with mobile clients
that use GET redirects. New implementations should use POST.

post.description:
Process GitHub OAuth callback and link account.

Validates:
1. CSRF state token
2. Exchanges code for access token via GitHub API
3. Fetches user info from GitHub API

get.description:
GitHub OAuth callback (GET alias for mobile compatibility).

**DEPRECATED**: Use POST /oauth/github/callback instead.

This is an alias route for backward compatibility with mobile clients
that use GET redirects. New implementations should use POST.

delete.description:
Unlink a social account from the current user.

Provider must be one of: telegram, github

get.description:
Get OAuth authorization URL for login (no authentication required).

Generates state token and PKCE challenge (when supported).

post.description:
Process OAuth login callback and return JWT tokens (no authentication required).

Validates state, exchanges code with provider, finds or creates user.

Re-authenticate with password for sensitive 2FA operations.

Required before:
- Setting up 2FA
- Disabling 2FA

Valid for 5 minutes.

Begin 2FA setup process.

Requires recent password re-authentication (call /2fa/reauth first).

Returns a TOTP secret and QR URI. The secret is NOT stored in the database
until verified with /2fa/verify.

Verify TOTP code and enable 2FA.

This persists the TOTP secret to the database after successful verification.

400.description: Invalid verification code or no pending setup

post.description:
Validate a 2FA code without changing state.

Rate limited to prevent brute force attacks.

Disable 2FA (POST alias for mobile compatibility).

**DEPRECATED**: Use DELETE /2fa/disable instead.

This is an alias route for backward compatibility with mobile clients
that expect POST method. New implementations should use DELETE.

delete.description:
Disable two-factor authentication.

Requires:
1. Current password
2. Current TOTP code

Returns one-time recovery codes (for emergency access if needed later).

get.description:
List all active invite tokens.

- Requires MANAGE_INVITES permission
- Returns token details including remaining TTL

post.description:
Create a new invite token for user registration.

- Requires MANAGE_INVITES permission (ADMIN or SUPER_ADMIN role)
- Tokens are single-use and expire after 24 hours by default
- Optionally restrict invite to a specific email address

delete.description:
Revoke an invite token.

- Requires MANAGE_INVITES permission
- Token will be immediately invalidated

post.description: Create a new system setting (admin only)

Create a single-use WebSocket authentication ticket.

The ticket:
- Is valid for 30 seconds
- Can only be used once
- Contains user context (ID, role)
- Should be used as ?ticket=<uuid> when connecting to WebSocket

This prevents JWT tokens from appearing in WebSocket URLs,
which would be logged by servers and proxies.

get.description: Security contact information following RFC 9116

Minimal health check for load balancers and orchestrators.

LOW-008: Returns only status to prevent service identification attacks.
For detailed health information, use the authenticated /health/detailed endpoint.

Detailed health check with dependency status (authenticated).

LOW-008: Service identification info only available to authenticated users.
Returns service name, version, environment, and dependency health.

schema.title: Response Health Check Detailed Health Detailed Get

src__presentation__api__v1__auth__schema.title: RegisterRequest
src__presentation__api__v1__auth__schema.description:
Registration request with strong password policy (MED-001).

Uses shared password validator for consistency with mobile auth.
Supports email+password or login+password (username-only) registration.

src__presentation__api__v1__mobile_auth_.title: LogoutRequest
src__presentation__api__v1__mobile_auth_.description:
Request schema for logout.

Used by POST /api/v1/mobile/auth/logout endpoint.

refresh_token.title: Refresh Token
refresh_token.description: Current refresh token to exchange for new tokens

src__presentation__api__v1__mobile_auth_.description:
Request schema for token refresh.

src__presentation__api__v1__users__schem.description: Response schema for a single VPN user.
